message_1:
Consider the predicate logic expression 

$\exists x \forall y (x > y)$

where x and y are variables over the domain of real numbers. What is the truth value of this statement?
message_2: The given predicate logic expression can be translated as "There exists an x such that for all y, x is greater than y." Since we are considering the domain of real numbers, there is no real number x that is greater than all other real numbers y. Therefore, the truth value of this statement is false.
